revised_title: Investigating the Small Vertical Movements of Stones on the Ground
tldr: The author conducted an experiment to measure the small vertical movements of a stone placed on the ground due to various factors such as earthworms, moisture, and frost. The study found that the stone sank more than the range of the micrometer screw, and the movements were influenced by the varying dampness of the ground and the action of earthworms.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Soil Mechanics
